subject: Pedals differences
description_text: Hello, I was about to buy one of your pedal sets, and I wanted to ask you what the differences were between the Plus X and the Pro X Ultra. Are the elastometers the same? How does the feeling of the brake change? How do you justify the higher price? So ultimately what are the differences between the two? Thank you very much.

conversations.body_text: Hi Dani Rajjal,    The main differences between PlusX and ProX Ultra are:    Pedal resolution: PlusX is 12-bit, while ProX Ultra is 16-bit.    ProX Ultra includes lighting effects and supports lighting telemetry.    ProX Ultra also features 8-stage damping fine adjustment.    Other aspects are largely the same.

The fact that in the pro x ultra the elastometres are positioned further down than the plus x does change the feeling?

> Il giorno 28 lug 2025, alle ore 03:52, service@simsonn.com ha scritto:
> 
> ﻿
> Hi Dani Rajjal,
> 
> The main differences between PlusX and ProX Ultra are:
> Pedal resolution: PlusX is 12-bit, while ProX Ultra is 16-bit.
> ProX Ultra includes lighting effects and supports lighting telemetry.
> ProX Ultra also features 8-stage damping fine adjustment.
> Other aspects are largely the same.
> 
> 
> 
>
Hi Dani Rajjal,  If lighting is not a major requirement for you, I recommend purchasing the PlusX.
